alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:07PM EST until February 18 at 4:20PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Rouge River At Detroit affecting Wayne County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rouge River At Detroit. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The river reaches bankfull. At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins in some park areas, the River Rouge Municipal Golf Course, and a few homes. Most flood damage occurs on the Upper Rouge River with minor flooding occurring on the main branch. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EST Thursday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 8.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.6 feet on 01/12/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
